poem:
**A Quieting of Clocks**

In the margin of time  
where yes is silence,  
friendships bloom—  
vine-like—rooted  
in the soil of  
"no".  
Amidst the busy din,  
a pause,  
softly spoken,  
breathes deeper  
than calendars.  
Absence,  
filled with  
a slow,  
steadfast  
growth.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How I beat overwhelm: I said no to social events – and my friendships grew deeper I used to equate a packed calendar with a full life. My days were booked up, well ahead of time, for dinners out, pub quizzes, exercise classes, trips to the cinema – activities that I knew to be beneficial or rewarding. I had been determined to make work less central to my life: I couldn’t burn out when I had". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
